metadata.synopsis: After accidentally reciting some magic words, track coach Steve Walker (Dean Jones) summons the ghost of the dreaded pirate Blackbeard (Peter Ustinov). The spirit explains to Steve that he was cursed by his wife to roam the Earth until he performs one good deed. Since Steve is the only one who can hear or see Blackbeard, he has no choice but to aid him in his task. Together, they help Professor Backer (Suzanne Pleshette) stop a gang of crooks from taking over an inn for the elderly.

reviews: [Peter Ustinov 's] very funny in the role of Blackbeard.

Middling Disney a la Dean Jones and Peter Ustinov; OK family fare.
Ustinov e Jones fazem uma tima dupla cmica em um filme que, de forma inocente (at mesmo bobinha), conquista pela despretenso.
The plot is completely confused, and kids, who are much better at these things than adults, will enjoy its twists and turns. Ustinov is fine as the rum swilling, yo-ho-hoing Blackbeard.
Undeniably silly and somewhat dated, Blackbeard’s Ghost remains harmless, modestly entertaining family fare.
Another stupid Disney live-action piece of inane cliches and situations.
